items.summary: Replace the existing sidebar navigation with a comprehensive design including navigation items: Home, Books, Authors, Trending, Upload Book, and Profile. Maintain the collapsible/expandable behavior with smooth transitions and dynamic content resizing that already exists in Version 24.
Ensure the sidebar and all new pages are fully responsive across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. On mobile, the sidebar should collapse into a hamburger menu or overlay that can be toggled.

Update the sidebar styling to use blue, gold, and white as primary colors with Van Gogh-inspired subtle textures. Ensure light/dark mode support is maintained and the sidebar adapts seamlessly with the page theme.

Create a Home page that displays a hero section with personalized book recommendations and trending books. The page content should expand to fill available space when the sidebar collapses. Use placeholder data for recommendations initially.

Build a Books browse page with advanced search input, filter dropdowns for genres and authors, and sorting options. Display books in mood-based carousels with trending sections and personalized book cards. Use placeholder data for the initial implementation.

Create an Authors list page that displays all authors with avatars and brief bios. Each author entry should be clickable and navigate to their public profile page. Use placeholder data for author avatars, bios, and profiles initially.
Build a Trending page that displays trending or popular books and collections. Highlight currently popular moods, genres, and top-rated books using placeholder data.

Create an Upload Book page or modal with a form for book file upload, metadata entry (title, author, description, genre), cover image upload, and series management fields. Display the form in a semi-transparent modal overlay with blur effects. Make it accessible to all users for now (authentication and author-only access will be added in Stage 3).

Build a Profile page that displays the user's avatar, name, bio, reading lists, and favorites. Include visible UI buttons for 'Log Out' and 'Delete Account' account actions. The Log Out button should clear the session and redirect to the landing page. The Delete Account button should open a confirmation modal and, upon confirmation, redirect to the landing page. Use placeholder data for profile information initially.

Add social feature UI elements throughout the platform including followers/following counters, review sections on book pages, and share functionality buttons. Display these elements with placeholder data and non-functional interactions for now (backend integration will come in Stage 2).
